Clinical: Albuminuria. Aphonia. Asthma. Cataract. Colic. Cornea, spots on. Eruptions. Eyes, affections of. Gonorrhoea. Gravel. Headache. Leucorrhoea. Lungs, oedema of. Rheumatism. Scurvy. Strangury. Toothache. Ulcers. Urinary disorders.
Characteristics: Armor. sat., and also Cochlear. officin., are old-world anti-scorbutics, and homoeopathic provings have confirmed the old experience. Armor. has the anti-scorbutic properties of the other Cruciferae, and is specially efficacious in scurvy from eating salt. The essential oil is said to be identical with that of Sinapis. The mucous membranes are affected: mucous stools; gonorrhoea; leucorrhoea; pituitous asthma and pituitous phthisis have been benefited by it. There are peculiar symptoms in connection with the teeth. Some violent abdominal pains were experienced. Tearing pains from the belly through to back, down the back, and settling in sacrum. "Colic with backache" appears to be a leading indication. Wandering chronic rheumatism. Touch or slight pressure < many symptoms. Bending forward >.
Relations: Compare: The Cruciferae generally. Canth., Caps., Rhus, Sinap.; Arg. n. (diarrhoea from nervous excitement).
Head: Headache, now one side now the other; < opening the eyes (wide), but not on reading or motion.
Violent headache with nausea; < sitting up.
Aching, boring pains in head, as if brain bursting.
Eyes: Obscuration of sight for some minutes.
Face: Twitching of l. corner of mouth, a.m.
Teeth: Dull sensation in teeth, as if they were soft and became bent and moved in their sockets on chewing.
Mouth: Very offensive odour from mouth and lungs.
Throat: Dryness of pharynx, larynx, and posterior nares.
Stomach: Unnatural craving for food with profuse painless diarrhoea.
Belchings of sulphurous odour, like garlic.
From region of stomach the pain draws through both sides towards back.
Cramp in stomach; pain drives to despair.
Crampy, tensive pain above epigastrium apparently in diaphragm, > by bending forward.
Abdomen: Spasms through to back and loins.
Stool and Anus: Profuse painless diarrhoea with craving for food.
Tenesmus all night till morning, sometimes discharging a little blood.
Involuntary passage of mucus from anus.
Urinary Organs: Urination difficult, causing burning, tenderness, and inflammation of urethra as in first stage of gonorrhoea.
Male Sexual Organs: Burning or cutting at glans during micturition; felt also before or after.
Female Sexual Organs: Stringy black blood passes from the vagina when urinating; also during the night.
Menses: every ten or fifteen days; suppressed with chlorosis.
Respiratory Organs: Promotes expectoration, and relieves cough; increases activity of respiratory organs.
Limbs: Towards morning pain in all joints when lying still; < lying on side; > on motion and when getting up.
Sleep: Sleep very refreshing; awoke with clearer mind than usual.
